column1: 141 kph, hint of inswing, but since it's on a full toss, Brownlie has a nice sighter. Flicks to midwicket
drifts a short one down the leg side at 144 kph, Brownlie allows it through to the wicketkeeper
good line, good length, great pace at 143 kph  as Brownlie is trapped at the crease against a drivable ball outside off. Only manages to push it to short cover
142 kph, slings it across the right-hander, who takes a step forward and shoulders arms

gets a thick bottom edge of sorts and the ball wanders off past second slip's right. Brownlie tries to drive on the up, but his front foot is again left out of the loop. Only moves after the ball makes contact with the toe end
that's a brilliant delivery, at 143 kph, curving into the left-hander. Latham does well to bring a reasonably straight bat down to save himself from being lbw

nails him on the front pad, on leg stump, on the full, but umpire Palliyaguruge is unmoved. Starc goes for the yorker, and this one sneaks through Latham's defences. He is hitting around his front pad, with a closed face. This looks mighty close and since it hit the batsman on the full... Ball-tracking shows all three reds. But Australia have not revviewed
fuller delivery moving away from the right-hander in the air, drives to point
camps back to drill a back of a length delivery into the covers

glorious hit through the covers. He does hit it on the up, but it was considerably wide of off stump, allowing the batsman the room to free the arms. Controls it well because he isn't trying to hit it too hard.
back of a length on off stump, defends from the crease
fine drive again, getting in line to a fuller ball on off stump, bringing his weight and a straight bat forward to meet the ball. Mid-off prevents any runs
forces him back in his crease with a shorter delivery on middle and off
146 kph, he is revved up! This is a good length ball outside off, pulling Latham forward to defend it, but it decks away past the outside edge
flicks it to midwicket
144 kph, beats him again. Hits a good length outside off, veers the ball away from Latham's prodding bat and then grins wryly.
hits the deck this time and he gets the ball to carry through over head-height through to the keeper. Latham shuffles, but then sticks his bat high up in the air
good length ball outside off, offers no shot

of all the balls to fall to. This is full. This is miles down leg. This has boundary written all over it, and Latham tries to oblige, flicking the ball in the air, looking for the fine leg boundary. Instead, he finds the only man there, Josh Hazlewood moving smoothly to his right, diving forward and taking a super catch. So Australia's non-review has cost them, and Starc, absolutely nothing
back of a length on off stump, covers it well
gives up width, and Brownlie wades into it with a square drive. Times it excellently, but Maxwell at point moves and dives to his right to snatch the ball from it's intended path to the boundary

is that a misfield at midwicket? Brownlie is pretty good through the off side but here he takes a fuller ball on off stump and whips it past Travis Head, the roll of the wrists giving him all the timing he needs. Of course, Brownlie gets a little help from a desperate Adam Zampa, who throws himself headlong after the ball, just as it seems to stop on the outfield, and flicks it onto his thigh and then into the rope
gets back and across and blocks on off stump
digs it in short, gains too much bounce for the umpire's liking
flows into an off drive, but finds mid-off. Hazlewood keeping the ball up, but never overpitching
opens the face a touch, holds some of his power back to make sure late outswing doesn't catch him napping and he finds a single through extra cover
shortish and outside off, chops it to cover
full and wide, the bait thrown for the drive, Williamson doesn't bite

looks for the yorker again, this at 143 kph, homing in on off stump, with some late inswing. Williamson jams his bat down hurriedly and gets so good a chunk that it flies past second slip and beats Hazlewood's dive to his left. Seems a touch slow in getting down to it
on the pads and Williamson tickles to fine leg, where Zampa runs around quickly enough, with the yellow floppy on, and saves a boundary
good work in the covers from Head, moving to his right to stop a backfoot punch from Brownlie
beats him for pace. This is another searing yorker, but it's just outside off stump. Lucky for Brownlie
more yorkers, this one angled from wide of the stumps into the base of middle and leg, Williamson blocks towards gully
good length ball, straightens a hint on off stump, Williamson defends with soft hands
gets a slight outside edge as Hazlewood pulls his length back a bit, while still stalking at the top of off stump. Williamson blocks cautiously
angled into the pads and Williamson is able to clip it through midwicket and mid-on. The ground's large enough to pick up three
presents the straight bat and it's got enough power to burst past Hazlewood. Although without his touch, it could well have been four
full, on off stump, drills a drive to the right of mid-off, who puts in a dive

brilliant shot! Cuts behind point. This really isn't short, perhaps that's why he hasn't gone for the full blooded cut. Shifts his weight back, glides the ball off the open face, using Starc's own pace against him
full toss, swinging in to middle and leg, nudges it to midwicket
moves across to a shortish delivery outside off and runs it between point and cover. Concentrates only on placement
has to get up off his toes to get on top of the bounce of this back of a length delivery, and then steers it to point cool as ice
141 kph, has him hopping again, and this time he tries a more aggressive stroke, trying to pierce the gap at point with a punch. Can't
he's into the flick a touch too early, if that's possible to a ball at 141 kph, takes the leading edge to the left of mid-off.
back of a length and outside off, defends
pushes his hands, and a striaght bat, hard at the shortish ball outside off stump, but picks out cover
beats gully, and the timing is good enough to leave third man a spectator. This has too much width and Williamson picks it up early, hangs back and carves it into the gap
a lot squarer this time. If Stoinis has to persist with his length, he might need a deep point. This one decks in off the pitch, but Williamson is ready for it, slashing the ball through point
waits on his back foot and blocks the ball, outside off, with such soft hands that it wanders down to third man
short and wide, Brownlie cuts but fails to pick the gap. Straight to cover
picked away, over midwicket. As lazy a delivery as any from a bowler still getting into his work, half-volley on leg stump, helped away to the boundary
139 kph, that's more like it. Lines it up outside off, pitches it full enough to bring Williamson forward, and then gets it to seam away ever so late to beat the bat
141kph, back of a length and outside off, dabs it to deep third man

brilliant hit down the ground past mid-off. Clear signs that this pitch has excellent pace and true bounce. The batsman can trust it explicitly, as Brownlie does, with this drive, even with his feet not quite moving.
141 kph, digs it in and since the ball hits the seam as well, it darts away from the bat as Brownlie, committed to a back-foot defence, is beaten
more evidence of how the batsman can make whatever he wants out here. Brownlie bends his top half away from a short ball intended to cramp him and upper cuts it over point
full, wide, lashed away through cover point. There is plenty of room to free the arms, and all he has to do is beat the man inside the circle. Does so to his left
full on middle, blocks firmly
shifts his line onto middle and leg, and Brownlie flicks through midwicket
whips it past square leg, towards the longer boundary for a couple of runs. Could there have been more?
shortish and outside off, Brownlie hangs back and cracks it to cover
tucks him up on his hip, as the ball bounces up a bit too high for his wrists to work it with any power through midwicket
good length ball outside off, Williamson steps forward to slice it to backward point
145 kph, good length ball, shaping in off the pitch, Williamson has very little room to work with and gets an inside edge as he tries to block
146kph, plays this short ball well, shifting across outside off to get the leverage he needs to whip it behind square leg
full on off stump at 147.5 kph, pushes to mid-on
goes for the fuller ball on middle, and Brownlie picks up the 119 kph variation early, waits on it and then flicks along the ground through midwicket
good length outside off at 144 kph, Williamson guides it to backward point
starts well, tossing it up, getting the ball to drift into the base of middle. Brownlie flicks, gets most of an inside edge through midwicket
gets beside the flighted delivery on middle and off and drives serenely to long-off. Excellent footwork to open up that gap
grunt of effort from Zampa, as he hits a good length and gets some turn and bounce off the pitch. Brownlie hangs back and pushes past cover
lobs up a full toss, extending himself perhaps a bit more than necessary, Williamson drives to long-on
eases into a drive through extra cover
prefers to stay legside of the ball again, even when it is tossed up. Drives through the covers
tip and run cricket now with Australia reducing the number of single-saving fielders. This full and wide delivery is deftly eased through point
keeps back to a 144 kph delivery, pitched on a good length on off stump, and Brownlie glides it to deep third man

144 kph, good bowling. Pulls out the bouncer, at top pace, and makes sure it is angled into the right-hander, rising up towards his grille. Williamson watches it carefully and sways out of the way. Great to watch
full on off stump and Williamson strides nicely forward, the ghosts of the bouncer nowhere near his mind, and drives to mid-off
tries to work a shortish delivery off off stump through midwicket, but is unable to. Didn't quite get over the bounce as he thought
defends a shortish delivery on off stump and the ball just plops down by his feet
a bit of a full toss again, drifting in on middle and leg, Brownlie nudges it past the left of short midwicket
brings a straight bat down on a tossed up delivery on middle, and moves to his right to stop any runs
sees Williamson advancing and changes his length, and pace. Quicker, shorter, forces the batsman to rethink his shot. No runs to midwicket
digs out a 88kph delivery on the base of off stump
manages to drive a flighted delivery on off stump past Zampa's left. Again, his footwork is to get himself leg side of the ball

tries to come down the track, while making room, and this time Zampa surprises the batsman with a googly. Brownlie hacks it, and mistimes it to long-off. It's only two overs, but lovely spell so far from the legspinner
squares him up with a good length ball catching Brownlie at the crease. It's at 145 kph too. Thick outside edge dribbles down to third man
144 kph, good length ball on off stump, keeps it out, consciously keeping his bat face down
144kph, waits on the short one outside off and dabs it to third man on the boundary
140 kph, goes for the bouncer, but it soars over Brownlie's head, even though he is ducking. Umpire Brown at square leg signals wide and his partner Palliyaguruge follows suit
goes for the on-the-up drive to a full delivery outside off and at 143 kph. Brownlie gets a thick edge to third man.

what a beauty! Extra bounce, and darting in off the seam too. It's that movement that does him. The ball begins as a short one outside off so Williamson gets a late cut ready, but he is caught off guard because it rears up, cramps him for room and takes a little tickle off the inside edge through to the keeper. Great reward for a probing spell from Cummins.
back of a length and outside off, offers no shot
eases it through to long-on
tosses it up outside off, Taylor comes forward and slaps it to cover
plays around his front pad as Zampa gets the leggie to drift in on off stump. Manages an inside edge to mid-on
drives with an open face towards point, where Cummins puts in a dive to his right
a touch short, which allows Taylor to rock back and cut to deep point

another short delivery, cut away through point and they're taking on the fielder, and the short side of the ground. The throw needs to be good.... but it's not, forcing the wicketkeeper to leap up and drag the ball down from well over head height. In that time, Taylor dives and makes it
falls short of the wicketkeeper. Hazlewood comes back into the attack and gets the outside edge as Taylor tries to cut a reasonably fuller delivery
full and outside off, drives it into the covers
short and into the body, Brownlie swivels into a pull and places the ball behind square leg
good length ball outside off, defends
nudges a short ball into the leg side, and having done so with soft hands and placing it well to the right of short midwicket, Taylor gets off strike
taps it towards square leg for a single and that takes us to the first drinks break of the match
waits on the ball to turn, after pitching on a length, and Brownlie slices it to point off the open face
that's a top edge, the two men at point are in business, but Faulkner, diving forward, had no chance really. A little extra bounce off a shortish delivery on fifth stump
good length ball on off stump, defends
comes down the track to the pitch of the legbreak outside off and drives to long-off
comes forward and hits all along the ground to long-off
lots of power from Taylor, bringing his bottom hand into play on this flighted delivery on leg stump. Single to long-on
back of a length on off stump, keeps it out
hammers the short and wide delivery to the point boundary. Has all the liberty he needs to pull off this shot. The pace from the bowler, the width to free the arms and the short boundary too
now to the long end of the park. Such a brutal pull from Taylor, dragging the ball from over shoulder-height outside off stump and blitzing it through in front square
full, aimed at leg stump, Taylor falls over while he tries to flick. Weathers half an lbw appeal. Would have slid down leg
full on off stump, pushes it to mid-on. Some late swing into the bat from Hazlewood

full and wide, and Taylor flays it away through point to bring up the hundred. Looks like he won't be holding back. Knows this is a good pitch, that he can hit through the line so easily that even good deliveries fly away.
shortish, into the body, makes the batsman hop. Brownlie deflects it to the left of the wicketkeeper

moves across into the off side to drive a full length deliveyr back at the bowler. Would be outrageous to call that a drop. Solid connection from the batsman, the ball was dying on its way back to Faulkner, and it went away to his right too

a thick outside edge runs away to the third man boundary as Faulkner, back over the wicket after the first ball, gets the angle working for him. Unfortunately though, he has four against his name for his good work
back of a length on off stump, defends
moves inside the line and flicks a shortish delivery off middle and off to long leg
full on off stump, from around the wicket to Brownlie, defends from the crease
full on off stump, Taylor is forward with a straight bat facing downwards
clips a shortish delivery on middle and leg behind square leg
on the pads again and Brownlie works it through to deep square leg
very little danger in that shot, given the liberty to free the arms, Taylor goes full blooded with the cut, soars over point and it's well to the right of deep third man. Nearly goes for six
back of a length and only a shade outside off, Taylor respects it with a leave
whips a full delivery on middle to deep square leg.
short delivery, angled across Taylor with the left-armer's angle from over the wicket. Mistimed pull shot fetches a single through midwicket
walks into a flick as he takes a good length ball on off stump and sends it to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off as Faulkner switches around the wicket, taps it to deep third man
fuller delivery outside off, drives to mid-off
takes a short delivery from outside off and pulls it to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, steers it to deep third man
fuller delivery on off stump at 131 kph, defends
full on off stump, Taylor is forward with a solid defensive push
uses the angle into him to his benefit as he flicks a short ball to deep square leg
there's a man sweeping on the off side boundary now and Brownlie's rasping cut only ends up a single
seems to have to deal with a little extra bounce at the last second as Taylor gets a little inside edge off the shoulder of the bat to square leg
full and a shade wide, Brownlie runs it to backward point
full on off stump, Taylor clatters it to midwicket
outstanding shot. There is barely any room, with Faulkner coming around the wicket, but Taylor is still able to carve it behind point. Waits just enough and then brings all his power into play
thick edge, flies past the wicketkeeper. Very tough to call that a drop, because Handscomb was diving full length to his right. Evades his fingertips
fuller delivery, perhaps slower too, defends
fuller delivery outside off, smacks it through the covers
full and outside off, unleashes a square drive to deep point
waits on a full delivery on off stump and tries to scythe it through extra cover, but there's a man there
full and outside off, drives to mid-of at the edge of the circle
shortish and outside off, hangs back and dabs it towards third man
loads up a pull and sends the short delivery outside off scurrying to deep midwicket
backs away to a fuller delivery on off stump and steers it to backward point

huge appeal for lbw but umpire Palliyaguruge shakes his head again. No review from Australia. This is just back of a length on middle and off, and Brownlie is on his back foot, playing all around it. Hit high on the back pad. Height the issue
flights it on off stump, Taylor pushes it back down the pitch
too short and Taylor rocks back, opening up his hips to nail a pull through square leg

loops it up, nice and slow, Taylor tries to hit it so very hard, ends up with an inside edge through midwicket. That brings up his half-century. He was 4 when Brownlie got into the 40s and has overtaken his partner to the landmark
shortish and outside off, cuts into the covers
stays back on middle and drives to long-on
laces it to the cover boundary. Just a little too much flight from Zampa on that occasion and Taylor gets under the half-volley and powers it away
full and outside off, pushes it to mid-off
goes for the blockhole outside off, Brownlie opens the face, looking for a single, but point is alert
blocks with soft hands into the covers and gets the affirmative from Taylor for a quick single. Top work from both batsmen
full and wide, Taylor cracks it to deep cover

that's his first ODI fifty, gets to the mark with a handsome drive to mid-off. Was out of the side for two years, and now he returns, on his home ground, to get an important landmark for him. Little raise of the bat and back to work
short and wide, Taylor reaches for it with a cut to deep point

cuts from the stumps, and despite the loads of risk involved, he times the pants off the late cut to the third man boundary. He plays the length, it's just short enough for those hands of his to take over and manufacture something beautiful
tosses it up on off stump, drives into the covers
frees the arms and drives in front of point. Nice and flowing

just lobs point running back, Stoinis backtracks, leaps up, gets a hand on it, but these kinds of catches have to stick. Lucky to survive is Brownlie, after coming down the track and deceived in the flight. He tries to check his shot, but still the ball leaps off the outside edge. Still, difficult to call that a drop
tosses it up outside off, dragging the batsman forward, making him reach for the ball, and then does him with the turn. Taylor nearly pops a catch to short cover
full and outside off allows Brownlie to strut out his on the up cover drive
offcutter on off stump, gave that away very early with a change in his action, the batsman stays back and flicks through midwicket
can't get the cut the way he wants because of the pace, and the line not really being too wide. Chops it to backward point
full and just outside off, defends

stays back even with the ball being full and pushes it to mid-off. Taylor is a little enthusiastic at the non-strikers' but seems to have dived back into his crease to save himself from a direct hit. Finch with the almost golden arm
back of a length on off stump at 145 kph, tucks it towards midwicket and Starc fields it himself
another direct hit, this time from Stoinis at point at the non-strikers' end. But Taylor, in danger again, has made his ground after playing a cut shot to a delivery on off stump

Brownlie seems a little fidgety now for some reason, perhaps being forced to get on with it when he isn't ready to. Comes down the track, and has made a little too much room for himself. Ends up with a thick outside edge that falls short of backward point
pushes it back at the bowler
comes down the track, so Zampa flattens the trajectory and directs the ball wider outside off. Taylor has to adjust and get bat to ball to avoid being stumps
eases it into the covers for a quick single, and Maxwell with a one-handed pick up, throws well over the bowler's head

no need to do anything fancy with the feet when you can stand and deliver like that. Positions himself leg side of the ball with Zampa always trying to angle the ball into middle and leg and then carves the ball over extra cover.
shortish and outside off, Taylor, for once, misses the cut
oh, that's annoying for the bowler. He has made Taylor push hard at a back of a length delivery that straightens off the seam but the outside edge hits the third man boundary
short and wide, Taylor has to reach as far as the wide line to make contact. Single to deep point
good bouncer. It's at 142 kph, angled into the right-hander, threatening his chest. Brownlie does superbly to keep his eyes on the ball all the way through and sway out of the way
works a short delivery off his hips to long leg
makes him hop, but Taylor gets the better of the bowler by using soft hands and dabbing the ball just to the right of the pitch
fuller delivery on off stump, plants it at long-on
gets just enough bat on a clear-the-front-leg slap down the ground to get himself a boundary. Faulkner gives him the length to leverage and he takes full toll
fuller delivery outside off, drives to the left of mid-off
that's the back of the hand slower ball at 108 kph, Taylor reads it well and nudges it through midwicket to bring up the hundred partnership at nearly run-a-ball

big appeal for caught behind, they're going up with the noise, but could it be bat hitting ground? Australia go for review. It's a very full, very wide delivery, that Brownlie looks to slice off the open face. Chris Brown, the on-field umpire, said no. But snicko points out a spike as the ball passes the bat. Umpire Dharmasena asks the decision to be reversed and so Handscomb has a second catch, this one diving forward to pick up a ball that is dying on his way through to him
full and just outside off from around the stumps, Broom steers it to point
digs it in short, and outside off, gains a little too much height off this hard pitch and is penalised for it
lays into a drive as this full delivery from outside off is sent to deep cover
back of a length and outside off, guides it behind point
full and outside off, drives through to deep cover
full on off stump, having gone wide of the crease, Taylor drives to mid-on
climbs on Taylor, does this short delivery, but he is able to defuse it around the corner at square leg. Good work with soft hands.
full and outside off, drives to cover. That's drinks, by the way.
deft little stroke as Taylor moves outside off stump to get close to a shortish delivery and run it to third man
opens the face against a good length ball to find a single through point
fuller delivery outside off, drives to mid-off
back of the hand slower ball, seems to bite into the pitch and bounce more. Taylor glides it to third man
closes the face a touch too early and a full delivery on off stump gets the leading edge through cover
good length ball on off stump, drives through the covers
bangs it in on middle and leg, Taylor rises with it and keeps it down
141 kph, goes for a pull against a short ball climbing past his left shoulder. Umpire calls wide for line

back of a length on off stump, Taylor drops and runs and Broom has a little problem with Cummins cutting across and racing past him - boy, the difference in speeds between the two is startling - and then the bowler kicks the ball at the stumps. Doesn't hit target as the batsman dives in
back of a length and outside off, slaps it through cover
goes for the bouncer at 145 kph, but it's too far down leg
full on middle, Taylor punches it to mid-on for a single
good length and outside off, Broom bops it to deep point
way too high, and way too far outside off. That's the third wide of the over. Walks back with a disheartened smile
144kph, full and outside off, drives through cover
shortish and outside off, and Taylor cracks this one, bowled from around the wicket, to deep third man
angled into the right-hander and Broom works it beautiful with a flick of his wrists, making sure to place the ball between long leg and deep square leg.
back of a length on off stump, defends
hangs back with his bat like a ramp for the short ball to ping off of to deep third man
drops it in front of point and scurries off for a single. Faulkner's back of a length becoming predictable?

huge nick and umpire Brown says off you go. Hits the seam and kicks up off the pitch. Takes the outside edge at the shoulder of Broom's bat as he comes forward to try and defend. Beautiful bowling, with just a little help from the pitch
fuller delivery outside off, pushes it through the covers.
tries to flick a shortish delivery off his hips, but he seems to be into the shot too early. Gets an inside edge onto his body.
fuller delivery outside off, drives to cover's left
fuller delivery outside off, hits to mid-off
good length just outside off, Munro tries to hit the ball a bit too hard and gets an inside edge down the pitch. Taylor walks up to his partner to have a word
surprises the batsman with extra bounce and Munro, shaping to flat-bat the shortish delivery on middle, ends up having to adjust. In the end, the ball hits bat and runs to point
good length ball outside off, hits the seam and nips away past the driving blade of Taylor. That's the impact of the grass on the pitch, holding it together and giving it its pace.
full and outside off, flicks it to the right of midwicket. Brings up the 200.
shortish and outside off, slaps it to the right of deep point
on middle and leg, Munro clips it to deep square leg
full delivery outside off, pushes it down the ground, looking for long-off, but short cover cuts across quickly enough
into the pads and Taylor is able to tap it through square leg
rears up off a length and hits Taylor's back elbow whilst he tries to defend
back of a length and outside off, Taylor finds a single at cover. Is he reassessing targets considering the way the pitch is behaving as it dries out?
stands up tall behind a short delivery outside off and punches it to mid-off

the pressure has told. Munro couldn't get anything away. Not even singles, with the field up. And here, he tries to chip a fuller ball outside off for a few runs but does so in the air. Starc at mid-off, comes forward and dives to complete the formalities
back of a length and outside off, and the ball just pings off he open face of the bat to deep third man. Lots of work for him to do
sliding down, which Taylor makes use of and flicks through square leg
shortish on middle and leg, nudged away to long leg
actually he does, it's the bluff from Cummins, as he puts in a good length ball, angles it across the left-hander and nearly has him caught behind. No feet from the batsman
another good length ball, on middle, Neesham is behind it this time
fuller delivery outside off, Neesham is still hanging back as he defends to point
digs it in finally and Neesham is in all sorts. Fends a 146 kph delivery off his chest but makes sure to keep it down.
another bouncer, and this time Neesham goes for a pull, and is beaten for pace and bounce

chops on and Neesham falls. Clever bowling from Australia, they've realised the kind of bowling that will help on this pitch, the cross seamers and slower balls and hitting the deck with the seam. This one climbs a bit more on the batsman and his trying to find runs at third man fails badly. The ball grazes past off stump, the bail takes a long time coming off, but off it comes. Neesham almost thought he had gotten away with it
back of a length on leg stump, defends
opens the face and glides the shortish delivery outside off to deep third man
tips in front of point and runs through to keep strike
fuller delivery on middle and off, Taylor is looking for a nudge through midwicket but gets a leading edge through cover
back of a length on leg stump, Santner blocks it
good length outside off, Santner blocks to point
opens the face and glides a shortish delivery to deep third man
gets up on his toes to a short delivery outside off and steers it to deep third man
top work in the covers, Stoinis diving to his left to save a certain boundary. Australia haven't bowled too many bad balls in the back end, and this one, a half-volley has been salvaged
plays a leg glance, using the bowler's pace and the fact that he strayed too straight for a single to long leg
pushes him back with a short ball on off stump and Santner can only pat it down to point
tries to flat-bat a shortish delivery on off stump, but only finds mid-off. Excellent fields from Finch. Most men up on the off side
bouncer, skirting across the left-hander, climbing over his left shoulder. Santner goes for a pull but is beaten for pace
back of a length, guides it to point. Could well be another one-run over in the last 10.
and finishes it off with a back of a length delivery on middle and leg. Santner tries to make room and punch it through the gap at cover. Only there's no gap at cover
shortish and outside off, cuts to deep point
shortish on middle and leg, defends off the back foot

well, there's something different. Gets a pitched up delivery on off stump and Santner steps gaily forward - he's not been able to do that since forever - and hits it over the straight boundary. First six, and first boundary in 12 overs
full toss angled into leg, pacy too, flicks it through to deep square leg
nails a yorker at 145 kph, swinging in late too, Santner is able to dig it out just in time to deep square leg
goes around the stumps for a full delivery outside off and spears it through point
good length ball on off stump, ticks it through midwicket
makes room and steers a shortish delivery to deep point
shortish and outside off, goes for the cut but is beaten by the offcutter
another offcutter, short and wide, Taylor has to reach out to make contact. Gets a single to point
full on off stump, defends
backs away as he tries to carve some runs through point, but Cummins one-ups the batsman with a slower ball which results in an inside edge down the pitch. End of a top spell: 10-0-47-1
gets a thick outside edge to the third man boundary. That's hundred no. 16, the most by a New Zealand batsman in ODIs, equal with Nathan Astle. Full and wide, he slashes, hard and gets away with it
fuller delivery outside off, pushes into the covers
full and outside off, drills it to mid-off
145 kph, full on off stump, gets an inside edge onto his boot. Has Starc got reverse? As if New Zealand didn't have enough things to worry about
low full toss outside leg, Santner heaves it to the left of long-on
smashes it over extra cover. Taylor picks up the slower ball, gets under it and beats the infield. Brutal, after a period of wondering what he should be doing.
short and outside off, crashes it to deep point
that's out of his T20 playbook, shuffling across to off stump and swinging across the line of a length ball. Misses it completely, of course, and gets leg byes to long leg
tries to hit the slower ball a touch too hard, looking to midwicket instead of long-on, and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
aims a yorker on the base of leg stump, Santner flicks it through to deep midwicket

pummels it... straight to deep square leg. Taylor walks off to a rousing ovation, but without him, New Zealand have no hope of getting to the kind of score they want. Good bowling from Faulkner, hitting a stump-to-stump line, changing his pace as often as possible
back of the hand slower ball on off stump, drives it to long-off

good length ball, pitching on a good length, outside off and veering away off the bat after pitching. Half an appeal from the bowler, the on-field umpire Brown says no, but Finch goes for the review. No mark on HotSpot. No Spike on Snicko
fuller delivery at rapid pace, Southee is slinking away from the line, throwing his hands at the ball. Beaten again
full as he aims for the base of off stump, Southee, for once, stays put and drives through cover
yorker on middle, Santner squeezes it to long-on
length ball, bunted towards long-on, but the timing is so poor that mid-off gets to it before long-on. New Zealand limp to 250
yorker on off stump, Santner can only save his sticks and pick up a single to square leg
Faulkner goes blockhole too, on leg stump, and Santner is able to heave it away to deep square leg

gets length and Southee winds up... this looks like six.. this should have been six a lot more easily... but Stoinis almost pulls off the most miraculous effort. He is on the edge of the deep midwicket boundary, leaping back sticking his right hand high and behind him to try and take a catch. Does so one-handed and sees Cummins running in from square leg on his peripheral vision, tries to toss it to him to complete the wicket. No luck there. And worse, the back of his boot stamps on the advertising triangles as he got hold of the ball. Great effort, though.
full and outside off, smears it through cover
lenght ball, swings and misses as it lobs over middle stump
low full toss on leg stump, Santner whips it behind square leg for a couple
gets the gap between point and short third man. The slower ball goes awry as Faulkner gives both width and the length to get under and crash it away

nothing better for a fast bowler. A searing 146 kph yorker on the base of middle stump and Southee, running away from the ball, leaves it free passage to hit his woodwork. Starc's pitch map today would make fine reading. So many into the blockhole

another yorker and the stumps are in disarray again. Ferguson's bat just doesn't come down quick enough. Starc just turns around after seeing the bails fly. He wants to get this over with, put his feet up, bag the trophy and go home. Seems to be getting some late away swing as well

searches for the yorker again but it comes off as a full toss, a high full toss, over the waist according to umpire Brown, who is not at square leg. Tight call that. In fact, the wrong call, the ball dips well below the waist when Boult defends it towards point.
swings at the free hit, which seems to be the slower ball outside off, misses
length ball outside off at 148,8 kph and it's smacked over extra cover. Starc's quickest ball comes in the last over of the innings
whips a low full toss over deep midwicket. A late flourish for New Zealand, Santner making up for all the balls he ate up earlier
finishes off with a six. This is length again from Starc and Santner is able to get under it with a slog over deep midwicket
starts off with a wayward delivery down leg, Finch looks to tickle it fine but the ball deflects off the thigh pad into the fine leg boundary
nips away from the length area outside off, left aloen
some shape away again, Finch stands tall and bunts it to cover
uppish but into the gap. Right to the pitch of the ball, and boom. Over mid-off, whacked for four. Can't overpitch to Finch
much straighter and fuller on middle from wide of the crease, eased to mid-on
gets on top of the bounce and punches it wide of Williamson at cover, solid first over for the visitors
starts off with a short of length delivery that slides across the batsman, defended off the back foot to the off side
worked off his hip into the gap at midwicket
full and shaping away from outside off, Marsh lets it go
bunts it towards the man coming in from point as they scamper a single
shuffles across and defends the length ball on middle back to the bowler
too straight and down leg, Finch gets some pad on the way as the ball deflects behind the wicket

glorious stroke! Full and swinging away, Finch gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts him through the line. The ball sails over the ropes at long-off. Just an extension of his arms but the timing was outstanding. Little or no followthrough on that occasion. Big, broad blades, yes, but the timing was super too
sliding into middle and leg, flicked into the gap at midwicket, excellent running
gets forward and taps the away-going delivery to cover
width and he's cracked that off the back foot to point
goes back into the crease and defends the short of length delivery back to the bowler
hops back and across, blocks an away-going short of length delivery again
shapes to cut but this was a lot fuller for him to play the stroke, beaten.
cracking delivery. Marsh shapes to cut again but this one nips back in to cut him in two halves. 142 clicks on that one
firm push but straight to mid-off
gets this to deviate from length area on off stump, he uses the depth of the crease to defend with an angled bat to point
stifled lbw appeal. Marsh plays outside the line in anticipation of an outswinger, but this one angles in and holds its line to hit him on the flap of the pad
this time he gets forward and bunts the inswinger back to the bowler. Top over, created some self-doubts in Marsh's mind
tough chance , but Southee has taken such catches before. So powerfully drilled that the ball nearly parried off Southee's hands to mid-on. Was hit hard and hit straight
angles this into middle from wide of the crease, worked to midwicket
tentative in his forward defense this time, on the move as he defends the outswinger to cover. Southee bowled that with a scrambled seam
slower delivery but he gets the angle wrong, way down leg and on the bounce to the keeper. 111 kph
glides this one away towards third man. Had all the pace in the world to play the shot.
played back with a straight bat, Southee stops it on his followthrough and threatens to break the stumps at the striker's end
angling into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
slides a length ball across Finch who shoulders arms
dabbed softly into the gap between cover and mid-off
whipped off his hip but straight to midwicket
uppish but one bounce to mid-on. Once again, Marsh was uncertain as to which way that was moving. Looked to drive, got a thick inside edge as the ball nipped back in. Pressure building
flicks and misses, hit on the pad. 11 balls in a row and he's just scored one off Boult
firm push wide of mid-off for a single
nearly chopped on. Didn't have the width to cut, got a thick inside edge towards fine leg where Ferguson did well to dive to his left and save two runs.
crunching cover drive this time. On the up, timed superbly. This was an outswinger that had enough width, and Marsh timed that beautifully. That should make him feel much better
glides this into the third man boundary. All timing and placement. Hint of width, Marsh opens the face of the bat late and then steers it behind point. Short boundary there too
slower delivery, but too full. Marsh gets to the pitch of the ball and cracks that into the cover boundary. Delayed the shot just a wee bit, moved into position and boom!
shows the full face of the bat and defends that incoming length ball
bunts the inswinger behind point as they steal a quick single
some outstanding wrist work! Did I just say pressure? How he's managed to wriggle out of that. Marginally overpitched, but he simply drove that back down past mid-on with an air of nonchalance

real bonus for New Zealand. Marsh was really slow on the turn. This was full on the pads, he flicked this towards deep square, where Mitchell Santner got to the ball quickly and fired a throw on the halfvolley to Latham, who did the rest. Have to say that was an excellent take from the keeper, and Marsh is caught comfortably short of the crease. Why would you want to self-destruct like that? He was just starting to play some gorgeous shots
width and he's driven that straight to mid-off

chopped on! New Zealand are back and indecision in footwork has cost Handscomb. Simply wafts at an away-going length ball, nothing shot really. No feet movement whatsoever. The ball crashes into the stumps off the inside edge
works an incoming delivery on middle to midwicket
solidly behind the line of that full delivery, defended back to the bowler
hustles in with a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, worked t midwicket
bouncer on middle and leg, ducks under that but not entirely convincing. Finch was on the move. 144 kph
floats this full on off stump, pushed to cover
gets on top of the bounce and fends the bouncer form outside off to midwicket. 147kph delivery. Finch was fraction of a second late but played it well
solid push to cover. 150kph this time, he's cranking it up
uppish but just short of cover point. Both feet were off the ground when he shaped to cut, didn't get enough bat on it. Nearly a wicket maiden
super timing on the flick, but the midwicket fielder does well to run all the way back to flick it back. Santner the man. Did well to dish in a slide to save one run. Not much swing
short of length delivery on middle, defended back with a straight bat
eased gently off the back foot towards mid-off for a quick single
straightens from a length area on off stump, Head is neatly onto the back foot as he defends
too wide and he's crashed that into the point boundary at the rate of knots! Sitting up nicely for him to play the cut, had to reach for it in the end but he hit that off the middle.
full and angling back in from wide of the crease, left alone
back of length delivery on off stump, bunted wide of cover as the get across for a single
hint of width, he gets on top of the bounce and glides this behind point. Third man goes well to come around. 149kph
punched to cover. Loud call of  'waiiiiiitttt'. 151kph
hustled for pace again, caught on the hop as the ball thuds into the top half of the bat and roll to the leg side
firm push this time wide of cover as they steal a single
floats this full on middle, Head defends from the crease back to the bowler
starts off with a short of length delivery outside off, punched to point
hops back and turns the incoming short of length delivery to the leg side
toe ends a pull on the bounce to midwicket. Tried to fetch it from outside off, and was through with the stroke way too early
crashed to deep point as they jog a single. A meter on either side and it was four
angles a length ball into middle and leg, turned to the leg side
opens the face of the bat and angles the short delivery behind point
driven on the up to sweeper cover
pulled from outside off, but there' protection at deep square. Rolled the wrists over that delivery to keep it all along the ground
whipped beautifully into the gap between midwicket and square leg. Just eased it superbly, all timing and class. Super wrist work. Using the pace, 152kph, to time that
firm push, not much flourish of the bat. Into the gap at deep extra cover, back for the second in a jiffy
whipped to midwicket, where Brownlie moves swiftly to his left to effect a one-handed stop. 152.3 clicks
slapped off the back foot to deep cover

Williamson won't be impressed with that effort at sweeper cover. Punched towards Brownlie, who does well to get to the ball, but the late bobble as he tries to push it back in with the slide results in the ball touching the ropes
angled into middle and leg, turned to midwicket
overbalanced, but he gets some bat on it as he works it behind square on the leg side
looked to go square on the leg side, ended up beating mid-off. Slapped. Forehand smash
angles a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, defended down to mid-on
lucky to get away with a leg-stump half-volley, picked away into the gap at deep midwicket
driven on the up to deep cover as they jog the single
hits the deck hard with a back of length delivery on off stump, punched to cover
turned the bat face early as he looked to nurdle it wide of midwicket, lobbed just wide of the bowler on his followthrough
can't pick the gap at midwicket. Looks to play a short-arm jab this time to the short ball angling into middle
both feet in the air as he tucks that off his hip to deep square leg
too much width, but is lucky to get away with it again. Crunched straight to deep point
drilled down the ground. Mid-off had no chance. Rocket hit. Too much flight and it was struck off the middle
slider across the batsman from around the stumps, turned to square leg
gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
quicker delivery on middle and leg, whipped to Taylor, who throws himself to his left. The ball was going away from him but he stuck out his left-hand to effect a one-handed stop and save a single
drifting across the batsman, who rocks back and eases it to deep cover
pulled to wide long-on, six off the over
drops a tough chance. Too full, Finch looks to go over the bowler's head but doesn't get the elevation. It was hit well alright, but Williamson was just a fraction of a second late to react
this time, he clears mid-off. Gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts him over the infield. Easily done
into the hospitality area at deep midwicket. Sure, it was the longer boundary but this was a full toss that had to be hit. Connected cleanly
backs away and hits hit hard, but straight to cover
slapped wide of cover, down to the boundary rider this time
straightens from middle, pushed back to the bowler
turns from middle, he opens the face of the bat to ease it behind point
driven firmly back to the bowler
rocks back and pulls, but hits it straight back to the bowler
slider across the left-hander from around the stumps, bunted to point
hit over the infield, on the bounce to Neesham at wide long-pn
makes a bit of room and places that into the gap between cover and point
looked like dragged the slog from outside off, but it it into the gap at deep midwicket.
punched down to long-on
looks to cut but was cramped for room, hit back to the bowler
rocks back and eases the short ball off the back foot to point
makes some room and crunches the short ball on middle to deep point
crunched to deep cover
slider on middle and leg from around the stumps, punched to mid-on
hint of width but he can't take full toll of that. Hit hard, but straight to point
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives this inside-out to sweeper cover. 15th ODI fifty
beaten as he looks to ease the slider behind square on the off side
full and straight on the pads, worked into the gap at deep midwicket. The fielder at wide long-on had to run around a wee bit to his left
nurdled with the spin to square leg
fired down leg, Finch lets it go
slapped to wide long-off. Once again too short. Finch gave it a proper thwack but found the fielder
drilled down the ground, Williamson deflects it on the dive towards mid-off
punched to Boult at deep midwicket. Looked like he was shaping to clear the ropes there, but didn't have much pace to work with
uppish but into the gap, down to deep cover

Santner had to decide in a split second if he was going for the catch running in from long-off or save three runs. Finch backs away and slaps that over the infield, Santner goes for the catch but the ball just falls short of him. What's worse? It's a four too

got lucky with the previous delivery, this time he muscles it straight to the lone man at deep midwicket. Looked to go over long-on perhaps, ended up dragging it a bit, and towards the longer boundary there, he stood no chance. New Zealand back into this
tossed up over the batsman's eyeline, he goes back into the crease and defends
whips the in-drifter to square lg
wrists it between midwicket and square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, Maxwell plays with a straight bat
gets onto the back foot and nurdles the incoming delivery to midwicket

this one drifts back in, pitches outside off and spins away, Maxwell shapes to cut, gets the thinnest of edges through to Latham who rides the bounce and takes an excellent catch. Very thin spike, there wasn't much on hotspot either. Maxwell shakes his head as he walks off
tossed up on off, driven inside out to cover
pushed through quicker on off, dabbed to the cover fielder again
eased with the spin to sweeper cover, once again generously tossed up
defends from the crease, gets an edge to short third man
turned to square leg, once again this was pushed through quicker
loopy delivery on off, spins back in to take a thick inside edge and roll back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, hit back to the bowler
drilled down the ground, but Santner does well to stop it on his followthrough
flatter one on middle and leg, whipped to square leg this time. Pressure building

gets this to slide across the left-hander, who dabs it wide of cover this time. Santner has asked the third umpire to check upstairs, he thought the bat was plonked, but all good in the end. He slid the bat in
drifts this into middle, Stoinis gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
turned to square leg as they jog the single
tossed up on off, defended from the crease to the leg side
driven to the cover fielder at the edge of the ring
full toss, looks to swing this to the leg side, slices this down to long-off instead
makes some room and punches the flatter delivery to mid-off
stays inside the crease and turns the flighted delivery on middle and off to the leg side
pushed through quicker on middle, whipped to square leg
tossed up on off stump, he lunges forward and blocks
whips an away-drifter to square leg. Can be risky if he gets one to bounce awkwardly
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it with the spin to midwicket
invites the batsman to go for a biff by tossing it up, drifted back in, solidly defended
slow turn from middle, he gets onto the back foot and defends
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it with the spin to long-off
slow turn back into middle, makes some room and punches it down to long-on
drifts in and straightens, looks to work it across the line but the ball lobs off a thick outside edge to the off side
eased with the spin to long-off, sensible stuff
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks
risky single with a push to mid-off, a direct hit would have made things interesting
can't get it away. Too short, sitting up nicely for him to free his arms and slap it away. What does he do? Hit it straight to cover
overpitched on off, Stoinis plays a stylish drive but hits it straight to cover
drops it gently into the off side with soft hands as they scamper a single
the flashing blade of Head. There was width and he crunched it, but straight to square third man
beautiful drive but can't beat mid-on. Allowed the ball to slide back in as he played with a straight bat
gets out of the way of that short ball. Banged in short outside off from around the stumps. Dropped his wrists at the last moment
gets on top of the bounce and turns it wide of midwicket
slower through the air, tossed up as well, from around the wicket. Head comes forward for a nudge to midwicket
flays to long-off as he gets to the pitch of a flighted delivery outside off
first boundary for Stoinis, and it's a classy one, coming down the track, connecting with the ball on the full and watching it scurry away through extra cover
drives it to cover
and there's another, this one goes over the rope as Stoinis takes a giant stride forward, with that he gets to the flighted delivery and launches it over extra cover
pushes it through quicker, and into middle and leg. Stoinis backs away and punches it back at the bowler
147 kph, drills a length ball down the ground, a little misfield at mid-off by Williamson allows the batsmen to take two
doesn't look comfortable against the bouncer, this one from around the wicket, at good pace, coming at Head's head. Gets a little glove, onto helmet and through to fine leg
147 kph, shortish and outside off, Stoinis goes for a cut but is beaten for pace
back of a length on off stump at 146 kph, defends
digs it in short, Stoinis ignores it, Latham can't hope to move quickly enough to his left
flat-batted down the ground, doesn't get all of it and that's why Southee running back from mid-on is able to pull it back inches inside the rope

edged, and past the wicketkeeper's right. This is a genuine mis-hit, Stoinis pushing at a back of a length ball, which seams away just enough to get past the middle of his bat. Had there been a slip, he might have been gone

ripper of a bouncer. He shaped to pull but then realised the ball was rearing up alarmingly and tried to pull out, but by then the ball had deflected off his shoulder and over the keeper's head. Handy runs
living dangerously, but will get another boundary to bring up his 5th ODI fifty. Length ball drifting into middle and leg, flicked wide of Taylor at midwicket
gets this to jag back in from outside off, Head punches this to mid-off
looking to reverse this, is he? Head shapes to drive but the ball veers back in late to take a thick inside edge back to the bowler
play and a miss. Too close to cut, the length was a touch fuller too
hops back and across to whip the incoming length delivery to deep backward square leg
clobbers that, but straight to Boult at deep square leg
rides the bounce and fends this into the off side, quick single taken. Weak throw from Broom, who recovered quickly from point and had a shy at the stumps at the striker's end
width on offer, he uses the pace of the bowler to glide this behind square, to third man
looks to arch back, but realises there's a chance to drop and run. Does so and manages to play it towards point
drilled down the ground but excellent work by the bowler to put his hand out in his followthrough and stop that
hops across and punches the short of length delivery to deep point

superb catch by Dean Brownlie at deep square leg. He had to be mindful of the ropes just behind him, but he kept his balance and judged the catch to perfection. Coming back to the delivery, excellent short ball at 140 clicks, Head had to fetch this from outside off. The ball got big on him but he went through with the stroke and simply top-edged it to the fielder in the deep. Lot of credit to the bowler, for the effort.
rolls his wrists over the pull shot, hit into the gap at deep square leg
so very close to angling this away-going length delivery to the keeper. Beaten for pace as he looks to run it down to third man
slower and fuller delivery, but Faulkner had to reach out a fair bit to defend that ,which he does

there was a wide slip in place specifically for this. Faulkner is squared up by the late movement, gets a thick edge that was dying on Taylor, who moves low to his left to complete a stunning catch. This is outstanding tactics from New Zealand. First to place the fielder there, and then set the batsman up before eventually.  sending him on his way. The front foot is fine, the umpires were checking for the catch. Kumar Dharmasena, the third umpire, had a couple of replays, before relaying his decision to the on-field umpire.
gets this to shape back in off the seam from outside off, left alone
goes back and across to whip a length ball on middle to square leg
firm push off the front foot but straight to cover. Some late away movement for Southee
short, wide and asking to be hit. Stoinis slaps it straight to sweeper cover
off-cutter this time, gets this to deviate back in from outside off, left alone
shoulders arms to a length delivery that deviates back in from outside off
wants the run but is sent back. Bunted to the man coming in from cover, was never going to be a single. Good call from Cummins
hops across and rolls his wrists over the ball to keep it down, towards square leg as they steal a quick single
gets this to reverse away from off stump, shoulders arms
floats this full and across the batsman from wide of the crease, left alone
rip roaring bouncer which Cummins had little clue of. Looked to get out of the way but was into a tangle. The ball lobbed off the glove to the off side, lands safe though
looks to tickle his ribs with a bouncer on middle and leg, gets the direction wrong
gets behind the line of that length ball on off, bunts it to point
top shot, lovely touch. Gets back into the crease and punches the short ball to sweeper cover
gets this to angle back into middle, bunted back to the bowler
play and a miss. Looked to drive on the up but was nearly done in by the late away movement
a half-stop at cover by Neesham gives a single. This was struck hard on the up
cut hard, but straight to Neil Broom at point
short-arm jab to deep square leg. Just a flick of the wrists to keep it all along the ground. It was short and he picked the length early

tipped over the bar! Taylor couldn't hang on to a tough chance at cover. He was airborne, timed his jump well but wasn't enough. Stoinis checks his shot as he looks to clear the infield, signs of grip on the surface? It didn't come on as well as he would have liked. Tough, tough chance
muscles a pull past mid-on, didn't get hold of it entirely but just about enough to beat the fielder
driven on the up to extra cover
backs away, opens up the off side and uses the pace of the bowler to glide the short ball down to third man
too short and way over the batsman's head. Correct decision from the umpire
drilled down the ground, what swagger, what timing! Stunner to say the least. Marginally overpitched, Stoinis stayed right inside the crease and lofted that down the ground with a straight bat
now shows he can play off the back foot too! Width and he crashed that behind point. Allowed the ball to slide in to the bat before dismissing that from its presence
in-drifter on middle, pushed back to the bowler
fired into middle, looks to force it through cover, can't find the gap. Straight back to Santner
the arm ball that drifts back into middle and leg, defended to midwicket
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it past the bowler to long-on
trouble, trouble, but the bowler breaks the stumps at the bowler's end while backtracking even before the throw could come in from point. Cummins had given up. Opportunity missed
gets forward and bunts the tossed up delivery on off stump to cover
firm push on the up to deep cover
floats this full on middle, worked behind square on the leg side for an easy single
smeared off the front foot but an excellent stop at backward point. That was travelling
through with the pull way too early, yes-no, yes-no from both batsmen, eventually they can't scamper a run even as point comes in and fires a throw
cuts and misses. It was short alright, but there wasn't much width for him to try the stroke
cut away, but straight to point again

he's picked out the fielder at long-on. Superb bowling from Santner, tossed this up but the ball dipped on Stoinis, who looked to slap this across the line but couldn't get underneath it and hit it straight to Neesham.
stays inside the crease and punches one to the off side
mows this across the line, but hits it on the bounce to square leg
lovely flight, Starc briefly flirts with a mighty swing but ends up defending to the off side
worked off his pads to deep backward square leg to get off the mark
slides back in to cramp him for room, bunted back to the bowler
cross-batted pull down to long-on, didn't time it well at all and gets away this time
short and way down the leg side. Not quick enough too to induce fear in the batsmen
gift of a delivery. Too short and sliding down leg, he gets a faint tickle that was needed to beat the keeper and fine leg. Too easy
looks to clatter this over midwicket but didn't get underneath the delivery. The late deviation did him in. Better bowling, took the pace off on that occasion
tucked straight to short fine leg, the man there had been brought up only prior to this over
clobbered into the gap at deep midwicket but the fielder already anticipates and runs in to fire a rocket throw
full and slanted on off, squeezed to long-off
when he hit it, it looked like this was a dolly to long-off, but the ball kept flying. A leading edge gone for six, would you believe it? 58-metre boundary there.
looks like Boult has pulled a hammy there. Flat it, he moved quickly to his left and dived full length to stop that on the bounce. Cramps as he moved, then landed flat on his face. Seems fine
hammered down the ground, straight into the sightscreen. Hit straight as a dye, got underneath the flight and boom
firm push off the front foot to sweeper cover
fired into middle and leg, thought it would be called wide but the ball drifted away to hit him on the pad
he's clobbered that over cow corner. Tossed up on leg stump, Starc takes him on and gets enough muscle on the slog. Big over, this isn't over by any means
floats this full on off, pushed to cover for a quick single
opens the wrists late to use the width and steer this late behind point. No chance for third man despite a dive. The pace of Ferguson made it easier for Starc
pushed off the back foot to cover
slants a short ball across the batsman, who looks to pull across the line but misses
too full on the pads and he's flicked it into the deep square leg fence. There were three men on the leg side, but he still managed to beat them. Too straight, too easily done.
too full on middle, squeezed back down to mid-off

he's hit this into Wellington! Way over the ropes. Runs are bleeding, and there's life in this contest and how. Right in the slot and Cummins was teeing off like he would on a golf course. Currently, New Zealand are running out of ideas
drops this gently into the off side for a quick single
worked into the deep midwicket region as they jog the single
too full, gets underneath the flight and squeezes it to deep point
fetches the slog from outside off towards deep square leg
too full, crashed to the man at the edge of the circle at cover
angles a short ball back into middle from around the stumps, steered using the width to square third man
right into the blockhole, Starc brings his bat down in time to squeeze it to cover
hammered down the ground, but straight to long-on

one shot too many and he's gone! Cummins looks to go through with the pull but was beaten for pace and hurried into the stroke, ended up lobbing it to midwicket where Santner made no mistake. Relief in the New Zealand camp. Is that it for Australia?
full and tailing back into middle and leg to hit Starc flush on the pad, but the ball would have missed leg by a mile. Reverse swing, and how
another toe-crusher which Starc somehow manages to keep away, gets it to square leg as they steal a run
bangs a short ball in but way down leg, easy call for the umpire
slower and fuller on middle, defended to the leg side. Looked like Starc was winding up to go leg side but couldn't hit it anywhere because of the length
hammered down the ground, long-on comes around to his right to cut that off
full and tails back in late towards middle, pushed to cover
stunning yorker, point precision. Zampa needs to be given credit too for keeping that out
full and wide outside off, looks to squeeze it behind point but ends up getting a thick inside edge that rolls to the right of Latham, who effects a one-handed stop
gets a thick inside edge down to long-on, they surely won't mind Zampa on strike

he's got five! Ross Taylor was brought in at wide first slip position precisely prior to this delivery and the plan comes off. This is a cutter, gets a bit of grip and bounce, Zampa hangs his bat out without any conviction, gets a thick edge and Taylor does the rest.
full and straight on off, Hazlewood just about manages to keep that out. Went for the yorker this time

he's bowling yorkers on demand now, how did Hazlewood keep that out?  Very, very close again. Right on middle, just managed to bring his bat down in time. Didn't have a high backlift, which allowed him time
excellent bouncer, angled in from wide of the crease, Hazlewood ducks under that one
crunched. Into the point boundary in a jiffy! Too short, enough width in the world for him to unfurl that cut shot. Australia need more of these

you beauty, Boult! Six wickets and New Zealand have regained the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy. Subtle change in pace with that length ball, Hazlewood look to force that through the off side, plays outside the line and can only get a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. New Zealand win the series 2-0. These are Boult's best figures in ODIs, his second five-wicket haul in his career, and both have come against Australia. The last time he did it - at the 2015 World Cup at Eden Park - was equally special.
